file_content.text: The Empire will think twice before using our people as bait again.
I almost didn't believe my eyes when the prisoners made it back.
Please hurry. Those prisoners don't have much time.
Those Imperial dogs have no honor!
A platoon of Twi'lek conscripts was ambushed by Imperial shock troops. Blasted Imps killed half the unit, took the rest prisoner.
I don't know how you pulled it off, but you got those men home. Thank you.
We received a holomessage from the Imperials' commander, Captain Targis, soon after. No demands. Just executed a prisoner and cut the transmission.
Shouldn't you rescue them?
Obviously we'd like to bring our men home. But that's exactly what Targis wants.
Every day Targis executes another prisoner to bait a reaction out of us. We've lost five squads trying to stop him.
Command has decided to cut our losses. Officially, we're abandoning the prisoners. I'm afraid you're their only hope now.
No way. [Refuse quest]
I see. I'll contact the soldiers' next of kin.
I will do what I must.
Make no mistake--you'll be walking straight into a trap. Watch yourself.
Even in war, there are rules and codes of conduct. Targis has spat on all of them.
The Imperials have commandeered a Republic outpost. They've got the entire area locked down and they're prepped to fend off any frontal assault.
How cruel!
Targis has a reputation here on Hoth. He's a monster, plain and simple.
Tell me my part.
Get as many of our people out as possible.
Sorry to intrude, sir, but we've got a crisis brewing and need the Republic's best to handle it.
Pardon, Master Jedi. I'm sure whatever brought you to Hoth is important, but we need your assistance.
Excuse me, Captain. I'm sure you're busy, but we've got a critical situation that requires your expertise.
I don't know what brought you all to Hoth, but I hope it can wait. We've got a crisis that requires your immediate attention.
I never would have forgiven myself if we'd left those soldiers at the Empire's mercy. Glad we didn't have to.
You're welcome.
That's war for you.
I'll rescue those prisoners.
I'll rescue those prisoners.
Count me in.
Not many would face near-certain death. Thank you.
It wasn't that hard.
The Imperials were tough.
I can imagine.
